intro: Schinopsis boqueronensis, commonly known as the Puna tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its small, compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh, cold environments and is often found in the Andean mountains. Its wood is durable and has been used by local communities for construction and fuel. Schinopsis boqueronensis plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
